name: Association for Education MLADIINFO INTERNATIONAL
goal:
Our main goals

To raise awareness amongst young people from the world about available educational opportunities and how these can be accessed to enable them to be fully integrated in the society.
To improve young people’s key skills to empower them to apply for different educational programs, training courses, conferences, internships and to improve their entrepreneurship, employability and provide information that helps people become more employable.
To provide the space for the young people where they could prepare for the active role in the society.
Mladiinfo International addresses this problems with the series of workshops, trainings, events and campaigns , through which has directly contributed to improve communication skills together with digital competence of more than 1,500 young individuals. Also, Mladiinfo platform offers the space for youth to express their opinions through their articles in English and has helped them improve their communication skills and build up their self-confidence and self-expression. Moreover, Mladiinfo International actively promotes volunteering – by hosting and sending volunteers we are contributing to the society not only by spreading ideas of tolerance and positive thinking among youth, but also by showing them the example that not all the processes in the society are solely financially driven.

Vision

To aid respective young individuals in developing personally and increasing their independence so that they could become more active agents in the society and thus transform it, which will make them more prepared for the forthcoming challenges they might face in the future.

Our mission

To help the young people from the world that need a particular support to fulfill their educational potential as they are challenged by many educational disadvantages caused by either personal, social, cultural or economic circumstances.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Communication, Education, Youth
euInitiatives:
The EU Initiatives followed by Mladiinfo International are the Community Programmes funded by European Commission as Erasmus+ Program (previously Youth in Action Program and Lifelong Learning Program) and Europe for Citizens Program.

EU Policies followed by our association are the ones in relation with Community Programmes as :

- REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL ESTABLISHING "ERASMUS+": THE UNION PROGRAMME FOR EDUCATION, TRAINING, YOUTH AND SPORT AND REPEALING DECISIONS No 1719/2006/EC,
No 1720/2006/EC AND No 1298/2008/EC

- COUNCIL REGULATION (EU) No 390/2014 of 14 April 2014 establishing the ‘Europe for Citizens’ programme for the period 2014-2020
